result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amount: $20.00
Domestic Abuse- No Contact Waiver. Signed by T.B. and Officer Meyer.
Domestic Abuse- No Contact Waiver. Signed by T.B. and Officer Meyer.

- $500 bond on file and posted 8/1/22.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tanya B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:46 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA: Michael Becker  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE declines PD representation and would like to represent himself. Court states DE will need to complete waiver of counsel before continuing. Off record at 2:48 PM. Recalled at 2:52 PM. CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA: Michael Becker  Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court. Court questions Defendant. Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to counsel. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC and SETC. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights for 10 days. Adjourned at 3:00 PM.  gll
